derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English  (denoting stibnite, the most common ore of the metal): from medieval Latin antimonium, of unknown origin. The current sense dates from the early 19th cent

means.word_mean: 1. a metallic element having four allotropic forms; used in a wide variety of alloys; found in stibnite
